dca_stuff_slow — Direct Coupling Analysis routines¶

This module provides additional direct coupling analysis operations.

Module Syntax¶

Empty.

Module Contents¶

dca_stuff_slow.get_seq_map(aln, pdb, chain_id, pdb_seq, seq_res, pdb_res)¶

Find the matching sequence in the alignment and return a dictionary, which maps the alignment positions to the residues of the structure.

Parameters:
  • aln – alignment
  • pdb – biopython structure object
  • chain_id – chain id of interest
  • pdb_seq – pdb sequence
  • seq_res – start and end residue ids of the aln sequence
  • pdb_res – start and end residue ids of the pdb sequence
Returns:

a dictionary, wich maps the alignment positions on the structure.
dca_stuff_slow.repair_pdb(pdb, chain_id)¶
Parameters:
  • pdb – biopython structure
  • chain_id – chain, which contains the correct sequence
Returns:

repaired pdb object.
dca_stuff_slow.get_sequence(pdb, chain_id)¶
Parameters:
  • pdb – biopython structure
  • chain_id – chain, which contains the correct sequence
Returns:

a list of the amino acids, which build up the sequence.
dca_stuff_slow.get_res_id_aa_dict(pdb, chain_id)¶
Returns:a dictionary of the first chain, which contains the residue id as key and the corresponding amino acid as value.
dca_stuff_slow.res_res_distance(res1, res2)¶
Parameters:
  • res1 – residue 1
  • res2 – residue 2
Returns:

minimum distance between any atoms.
dca_stuff_slow.get_structure_map(contact_map, dist_map, neighbor_map, pdb, chain_id, seq_map, min_distance=8, seq_distance=5)¶
Parameters:
  • contact_map – add a contact
  • dist_map – add the corresponding distance
  • neighbor_map – add sequence neighbor information
  • pdb – biopython structure
  • chain_id – chain, which contains the correct sequence
  • min_distance – minimum distance between any two atoms (Morcos2011)
Returns:

a list containing three numpy arrays:

  1. contact map: 0’s (no contact) and 1’s (contact), where a contact is defined as either a c_alpha - c_alpha distance less than 0.8 nm or any atom - atom distance less than 0.5 nm.
  2. min distance map: min distance between all the residues
  3. neighbor map: is the found minimal distance pair a neighbor (1) or not (0).
